item.title: HPE 2026 财年业绩低于预期，股价下跌
item.description: 惠普企业公司（Hewlett Packard Enterprise）周三预测的年度利润和收入低于华尔街预期，原因是该公司在收购瞻博网络（Juniper Networks）后将服务器业务转向人工智能和网络。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise forecast annual profit and revenue below Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, as it shifts its server business toward artificial intelligence and networking following its Juniper Networks acquisition.】

item.title: Salesforce 预测 2030 年收入将超过 600 亿美元
item.description: Salesforce 在本周三举行的 Dreamforce 大会上发布的一份报告显示，Salesforce 预计 2030 年的收入将超过 600 亿美元。【原文：Salesforce expects revenue of more than $60 billion in 2030, according to a presentation made at its Dreamforce event on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国能源部终止对美国电池公司氢氧化锂项目的拨款
item.description: 美国电池技术公司（American Battery Technology）周三表示，美国能源部已终止对该公司建立电池正极级氢氧化锂生产设施的拨款。【原文：American Battery Technology said on Wednesday the U.S. Department of Energy has terminated its grant for the setting up of a facility for the manufacturing of battery cathode grade lithium hydroxide.】

item.title: 人工智能支出激增，台积电第三季度利润有望创纪录
item.description: 由于对人工智能基础设施的需求激增，全球最大的先进人工智能芯片制造商台积电第三季度利润将大增 28%，创下历史新高，不过美国关税可能会使其前景复杂化。【原文：TSMC, the world's largest manufacturer of advanced artificial intelligence chips, is set to post a 28% jump in third-quarter profit to reach a record high due to surging demand for AI infrastructure, though U.S. tariffs may complicate its outlook.】

item.title: 备忘录称，高盛全球联席主管兼公共投资首席信息官将于 2026 年退休
item.description: 根据路透社周三看到的一份备忘录，高盛资产管理公司（Goldman Sachs Asset Management）全球联席主管兼公共投资首席投资官 Ashish Shah 将于明年退休。【原文：Goldman Sachs Asset Management's global co-head and chief investment officer of public investing, Ashish Shah, will retire from the partnership next year, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织敦促日本央行 "循序渐进 "地提高利率
item.description: 国际货币基金组织的一位高级官员周三表示，由于全球贸易的不确定性给经济前景蒙上了阴影，日本央行必须保持宽松的货币政策，并循序渐进地提高利率。【原文：The Bank of Japan must keep monetary policy loose and move very gradually in raising interest rates as global trade uncertainty clouds the economic outlook, a senior International Monetary Fund official said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 交易日：风险在，还是不在？是交易还是收益
item.description: 了解推动全球市场的各种力量【原文：Making sense of the forces driving global markets】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行发现降息后金融环境出现松动迹象
item.description: 澳大利亚中央银行看到，在今年三次降息之后，金融条件正在放松，家庭和企业可以随时获得信贷。【原文：Australia's central bank is seeing signs that financial conditions are loosening after three interest rate cuts this year and credit is readily available to households and businesses.】

item.title: Core Scientific 董事会要求股东投票支持 CoreWeave 交易
item.description: Core Scientific 董事会周三敦促其股东投票支持公司出售给 CoreWeave 的提议。【原文：Core Scientific's board urged its shareholders on Wednesday to vote for the company's proposed sale to CoreWeave .】

item.title: 贝塔技术公司制定美国首次公开募股条款
item.description: 电动飞机制造商贝塔科技公司（Beta Technologies）周三确定了即将在美国首次公开募股的条款。【原文：Electric aircraft maker Beta Technologies set the terms for its upcoming initial public offering in the United States on Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚西太平洋银行 2025 财年下半年计提 1.77 亿美元重组费用
item.description: 澳大利亚西太平洋银行（Westpac）周四表示，作为其 "适合增长"（Fit for Growth）计划中生产力举措的一部分，该行已在 2025 财年下半年确认了 2.73 亿澳元（1.7772 亿美元）的重组费用。【原文：Australian lender Westpac said on Thursday it had recognised a restructuring charge of A$273 million ($177.72 million) in the second half of fiscal 2025, as part of its productivity initiatives under its Fit for Growth program.】

item.title: Adtalem 和谷歌云将为医疗保健专业人士推出人工智能证书计划
item.description: Adtalem 全球教育公司周三表示，将与 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌云公司合作推出一项人工智能证书计划，旨在帮助学生和医疗保健专业人员在临床实践中使用人工智能工具。【原文：Adtalem Global Education said on Wednesday it will partner with Alphabet's Google Cloud to launch an artificial intelligence credential program aimed at students and healthcare professionals to use AI tools in clinical practice.】

item.title: 杜邦董事会批准 Qnity 分拆上市
item.description: 工业材料制造商杜邦公司周三表示，该公司董事会已经批准了此前宣布的电子业务 Qnity Electronics 的分拆计划。【原文：Industrial materials maker DuPont's board has approved the previously announced separation of its electronic business, Qnity Electronics, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 阿根廷希望在中期投票前敲定 200 亿美元的掉期额度
item.description: 阿根廷经济部长路易斯-卡普托（Luis Caputo）表示，他希望 "很快 "执行一个框架，该框架将包含美国最近与阿根廷央行达成的 200 亿美元货币互换协议的条款，最好是在本月中期选举之前。【原文：Argentina's Economy Minister Luis Caputo said he hopes to "very soon" execute a framework that will contain the terms of a $20 billion currency swap the U.S. recently agreed with Argentina's central bank, ideally before this month's midterm election.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行行长表示，澳大利亚央行正在判断是否需要进一步放宽政策
item.description: 澳大利亚最高央行行长表示，消费支出的回升和部分通胀读数的上升，让决策者们开始考虑是否需要进一步降息。【原文：Australia's top central banker said a pickup in consumer spending and higher readings on some parts of inflation had given policymakers pause to consider whether further interest rate cuts were needed.】

item.title: 美国银行利用美联储回购机制，隔夜利率攀升，显示资金紧张
item.description: 央行数据显示，美国银行周三从美联储常备回购机制（SRF）借入 65 亿美元，回购利率上升，表明在本周将进行大规模国债净结算的情况下，履行融资义务的资金紧张。【原文：U.S. banks borrowed $6.5 billion from the Federal Reserve's Standing Repo Facility (SRF) on Wednesday, central bank data showed, and repurchase rates rose, suggesting tightness in meeting funding obligations with a large net Treasuries settlement due this week.】

item.title: 阿布拉航空集团将提交美国 IPO 注册声明草案
item.description: 控制着巴西戈尔航空公司（Gol）和哥伦比亚阿维安卡航空公司（Avianca）的阿布拉集团（Abra Group）周三表示，打算秘密提交一份拟在美国首次公开发行股票的注册声明草案。【原文：Abra Group, which controls Brazilian airline Gol and Colombia's Avianca, intends to confidentially submit a draft registration statement for a proposed initial public offering in the United States, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 受高端旅行需求拉动，美国联合航空公司预计第四季度利润强劲
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周三预测，由于高端旅行需求强劲和定价能力提高，第四季度利润将高于预期。【原文：United Airlines on Wednesday forecast a higher-than-expected profit in the fourth quarter on the back of robust demand for premium travel and improved pricing power.】

item.title: 美国合众银行为数字资产和资金流动成立专门部门
item.description: 美国合众银行（U.S. Bancorp）周三表示，该公司已成立了一个专注于数字资产和资金流动的新部门，以加快发展并增加新兴数字产品和服务的收入。【原文：U.S. Bancorp said on Wednesday it had formed a new unit focused on digital assets and money movement to speed up development as well as grow the revenue from emerging digital products and services.】

item.title: 美国航空集团以航空风险为由敦促政府结束关门
item.description: 美国一家航空公司贸易集团的负责人敦促政府结束为期 15 天的停摆，理由是他担心停薪留职的空中交通管制员面临越来越大的压力。【原文：The head of a U.S. airline trade group urged an end to the 15-day government shutdown, citing concerns about rising pressure faced by air traffic controllers who are working without pay.】

item.title: 纽约梅隆银行因涉嫌与杰弗里-爱泼斯坦有财务关系而被起诉
item.description: 一名自称受到已故金融家和性犯罪者杰弗里-爱泼斯坦虐待的妇女周三起诉纽约梅隆银行，指控该银行向他的性交易受害者支付了 3.78 亿美元。【原文：A woman who says she was abused by the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sued Bank of New York Mellon on Wednesday, alleging the bank processed $378 million in payments to victims of his sex trafficking.】

item.title: 墨西哥国家石油公司与强大的工会达成加薪 4.5% 的协议
item.description: 墨西哥国家能源公司 Pemex 周三表示，作为修订 2025-2027 年集体谈判协议的一部分，该公司已与强大的 STPRM 石油工人工会就加薪 4.5% 达成一致。【原文：Mexican state energy company Pemex said on Wednesday it had agreed with the powerful STPRM oil workers union on a 4.5% salary increase as part of the revision of the 2025-2027 collective bargaining agreement.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：美国监管机构准备为社区银行提供资本减免
item.description: 彭博新闻社周三援引知情人士的话报道称，美国监管机构将发布一项计划，通过放宽一系列资本要求来鼓励小型银行增加贷款。【原文：US regulators are set to release a plan to encourage small banks to lend more by easing a set of capital requirements, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 摩根大通和高盛留在中国，但业务有所转移
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）和高盛（Goldman Sachs）银行高管周三表示，随着与美国的紧张关系升级，全球市场笼罩在紧张气氛中，摩根大通和高盛将坚持在中国开展业务。【原文：JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs are sticking with their businesses in China as escalating tensions with the U.S. loom over global markets, bank executives said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储称最近几周美国经济活动变化不大，就业稳定
item.description: 美联储周三表示，最近几周美国经济活动变化不大，就业基本稳定，尽管有更多企业报告称裁员，这加剧了人们对劳动力市场疲软的担忧。【原文：U.S. economic activity was little changed and employment was largely stable in recent weeks even as more businesses reported headcount reductions, the Federal Reserve said on Wednesday, reinforcing concerns about labor market softening.】

item.title: 美国银行因涉嫌与杰弗里-爱泼斯坦有经济往来而被起诉
item.description: 一名自称受到已故金融家和性犯罪者杰弗里-爱泼斯坦（Jeffrey Epstein）虐待的妇女周三起诉美国银行，称该银行在知情的情况下提供金融服务，使其多年来的性交易活动得以进行。【原文：A woman who says she was abused by the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sued Bank of America on Wednesday, alleging the bank knowingly provided financial services that enabled his sex trafficking operation for years.】

item.title: Volatility Shares 申请美国首个潜在 5 倍杠杆 ETF
item.description: Volatility Shares 是一家交易所交易基金发行商，该公司周三申请推出总共 27 种高杠杆 ETF，其中包括首次提议在美国市场推出的 5 倍杠杆 ETF。【原文：Volatility Shares, an issuer of exchange-traded funds, filed on Wednesday to launch a total of 27 highly leveraged ETFs, including the first-ever proposed 5x ETF for the U.S. market, at a time of rising caution over inflated asset prices as markets continue their upward swing.】

item.title: 华尔街顶级银行强调消费者的适应力
item.description: 华尔街最大的银行在第三季度财报中强调了美国消费者的韧性，并补充说，尽管利率上升和经济存在不确定性，但迄今为止信贷并未出现裂痕。【原文：Wall Street's biggest banks kicked off third-quarter earnings by highlighting the resilience of U.S. consumers and added that credit has shown no cracks so far despite higher rates and economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 白宫预算主管计划在数月内关闭美国消费者金融监督机构
item.description: 白宫预算主任拉塞尔-沃尔特（Russell Vought）周三表示，他希望关闭美国消费者金融保护局，并预计在未来两三个月内关闭该机构。【原文：White House budget director Russell Vought said on Wednesday he wants to close the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and expects to do so within the next two to three months.】

item.title: 主经纪业务蓬勃发展为华尔街银行带来第三季度巨额暴利
item.description: 华尔街价值数十亿美元的大宗经纪业务正在全面启动。【原文：Wall Street's multibillion-dollar prime brokerage machinery is firing on all cylinders.】
